description:
Do you use the Blackboard Learning Management System to deliver hybrid or online classes? Are you new to the Blackboard platform? Then this class is for you! Make your course easier to teach and easier for students to take by learning how to put your course on Blackboard! 

Here is some key information about this course:

Target audience: Educators who use the Blackboard Learning Management System

Key topics  covered in this course: This course contains 14 lectures broken up into 6 Sections that teach you how to style and customize your Blackboard page, upload documents, post assignments to the Discussion Board and create tests on Blackboard

Time commitment:  The time commitment on your part is very minimal! Most lectures are about 2-5 minutes, with none longer than 10 minutes

Requirements or prerequisites to take the course: Have a Blackboard course that you can follow along and practice in. If you don't have a Blackboard account, you can create one for free on CourseSites which is a platform made by Blackboard that is completely FREE for anyone to use.

How to get the most out of this course: Follow along and practice with me!!!

What will you be able to do after completing the course: Have an AWESOME Blackboard course!


Benefits of taking this course:

  • Learn how to put your course on Blackboard yourself! 
  • Design your course the way you want it!
  • Make your Blackboard course easy for students to navigate!
  • No more printing or emailing documents to your students. Put all your course documents up on Blackboard!
  • Have Blackboard grade your tests by putting your tests on Blackboard!


Please note that there are MANY features of Blackboard that I do NOT review in this basic course. Please read the description of each section and lecture to determine if a feature you are interested in will be presented. Most additional features will be covered in my other Udemey courses.
title: How to put your course on Blackboard
